page.title: 10MANOR INN
page.content: THE MANOR INN IS SITUATED IN WHAT WAS ONCE THE MANOR HOUSE.THE LAST SQUIRE WAS MR.HENRY PORTER,WHO DIED IN 1871. THE PUB IS NOW OWNED BY WHITBREAD'S BREWERY.THE PRESENT TENANTS ARE MR CYRIL WHITE AND HIS WIFE,ELAINE.MR WHITE HAS BEEN LANDLORD FOR MANY YEARS.THERE IS A LOUNGE AND A PUBLIC BAR,ALSO A VERY LONG AND DIFFICULT SKITTLE ALLEY.THIS POPULAR GAME HAS NINE SKITTLES SET UP IN A DIAMOND SHAPE AT THE END OF THE ALLEY.THE LARGEST PIN, CALLED THE LANDLORD,IS PLACED IN THE MIDDLE.THE PLAYERS HAVE THREE BALLS EACH WITH WHICH TO KNOCK DOWN THE NINE PINS.THESE AND THE BALLS ARE SKILLFULLY MADE OF ASH AND ARE VERY HEAVY.LADS,KNOWN AS "STICKERS UP" SET UP THE PINS AFTER EACH PLAYER'S TURN.THE WINNING TEAM IS THE ONE WHICH KNOCKS DOWN THE MOST PINS.BEER,WINE, SPIRITS OR SOFT DRINKS ARE CONSUMED.
